dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Abies{/it}) of north temperate evergreen trees of the pine family that have flattish leaves, circular leaf scars, and erect female cones and are valued for their wood
{bc}any of various conifers (such as the Douglas fir) of other genera

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}fyrh{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}forha{/it} fir, Latin {it}quercus{/it} oak
shortdef: any of a genus (Abies) of north temperate evergreen trees of the pine family that have flattish leaves, circular leaf scars, and erect female cones and are valued for their wood; also : any of various conifers (such as the Douglas fir) of other genera

dt: {bc}a resinous North American fir ({it}Abies balsamea{/it}) that is widely used for pulpwood and as a Christmas tree and is the source of Canada balsam

shortdef: a resinous North American fir (Abies balsamea) that is widely used for pulpwood and as a Christmas tree and is the source of Canada balsam

dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Pseudotsuga{/it}) of tall evergreen timber trees of the pine family having thick bark, pitchy wood, and pendulous cones
{bc}one ({it}P. menziesii{/it} synonym {it}P. taxifolia{/it}) chiefly of the western U.S. {dx}see {dxt|cone|cone|illustration}{/dx}

shortdef: any of a genus (Pseudotsuga) of tall evergreen timber trees of the pine family having thick bark, pitchy wood, and pendulous cones; especially : one (P. menziesii synonym P. taxifolia) chiefly of the western U.S.

dt: {bc}a southern Appalachian fir ({it}Abies fraseri{/it}) that resembles the balsam fir

shortdef: a southern Appalachian fir (Abies fraseri) that resembles the balsam fir

dt: {bc}a lofty fir tree ({it}Abies grandis{/it}) of the northwestern chiefly Pacific coastal region of North America with cylindrical greenish cones and soft wood

shortdef: a lofty fir tree (Abies grandis) of the northwestern chiefly Pacific coastal region of North America with cylindrical greenish cones and soft wood

dt: {bc}any of various firs (genus {it}Abies{/it}) with leaves that are white or silvery white beneath

shortdef: any of various firs (genus Abies) with leaves that are white or silvery white beneath; especially : a valuable European timber tree (A. alba)

dt: {bc}a medium-sized fir ({it}Abies lasiocarpa{/it}) of subalpine regions of North America having bluish-green white-lined needles

shortdef: a medium-sized fir (Abies lasiocarpa) of subalpine regions of North America having bluish-green white-lined needles

dt: {bc}a large fir ({it}Abies concolor{/it}) of western North America with pale usually bluish-green foliage, a narrow erect crown, and soft wood that is used for lumber

shortdef: a large fir (Abies concolor) of western North America with pale usually bluish-green foliage, a narrow erect crown, and soft wood that is used for lumber
